intro: Candolleodendron brachystachyum, commonly known as the short-stalked hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, yellow, or orange. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
